summary: The Medicare and Social Security Fair Share Act aims to increase funding for Social Security and Medicare. The bill modifies payroll taxes, imposing a higher wage base for social security taxes and an additional hospital insurance tax on high-income earners. It also adjusts taxes on self-employment income and modifies taxes on unearned income and specifies how revenue from these new taxes should be distributed to the Social Security and Medicare trust funds. The changes apply to remuneration paid and taxable years starting after December 31, 2025.
